title: Sins of Colonialism - Collection 15 (.. in the Middle East 2)
description:
Sins of Colonialism - Collection 15 (.. in the Middle East 2):

We have 33 titles here:

-  Adams - Egypt Past and Present, with a Narrative of Its Occupation by the British, and the Recent Events in Soudan (1894)

-  Almog - Britain, Israel and the United States 1955-1958 (2003)

-  Askari - Collaborative Colonialism; the Political Economy of Oil in the Persian Gulf (2013)

-  Barker - The Bastard War; the Mesopotamian Campaign of 1914-1918 (1967)

-  Bayandor - Iran and the CIA; the Fall of Mosaddeq Revisited (2010)

-  Ben-Zvi - Decade of Transition; Eisenhower, Kennedy, and the Origins of the American-Israeli Alliance (1998)

-  Blackwell - British Military Intervention and the Struggle for Jordan; King Hussein, Nasser and the Middle East Crisis, 1955-1958 (2009)

-  Blunt - Secret History of the English Occupation of Egypt; Being a Personal Narrative of Events (1922)

-  Cole - Napoleon's Egypt; Invading the Middle East (2007)

-  Copeland - The Game of Nations; the Amorality of Power Politics (1969)

-  Fiore - Anglo-Italian Relations in the Middle East, 1922-1940 (2010)

-  Grainger - The Battle for Palestine, 1917 (2006)

-  Haynes - Lawrence of Arabia's Secret Air Force, Based on the Diary of Flight Sergeant George Hynes (2010)

-  Hinchcliffe et al - Without Glory in Arabia; the British Retreat from Aden (2006)

-  Kent (Ed.) - The Great Powers and the End of the Ottoman Empire (1984)

-  Khuri-Makdisi - The Eastern Mediterranean and the Making of Global Radicalism, 1860-1914 (2010)

-  Kitchen - The British Imperial Army in the Middle East; Morale and Military Identity in the Sinai and Palestine Campaigns, 1916-18 (2014)

-  Majd - Great Britain and Reza Shah; the Plunder of Iran, 1921-1941 (2001)

-  Mazza - Jerusalem from the Ottomans to the British (2009)

-  Meouchy & Sluglett (Eds.) - The British and French Mandates in Comparative Perspectives (2004)

-  Meyer & Brysac - Kingmakers; the Invention of the Modern Middle East (2008)

-  Miller (Ed.) - Britain, Palestine and Empire; the Mandate Years (2010)

-  Milner - England in Egypt, 9e (1902)

-  Murphy - The Arab Revolt, 1916-18; Lawrence Sets Arabia Ablaze (2008)

-  Nasasra et al (Eds.) - The Naqab Bedouin and Colonialism; New Perspectives (2015)

-  Rutledge - Enemy on the Euphrates; the British Occupation of Iraq and the Great Arab Revolt, 1914-1921 (2014)

-  Shamsy - Egypt and the Rights of Nations; an Egyptian People (1918)

-  Sykes - Crossroads to Israel, 1917-1948 (1965)

-  Townshend - When God Made Hell; the British Invasion of Mesopotamia and the Creation of Iraq, 1914-1921 (2010)

-  Viorst - Storm from the East; the Struggle between the Arab World and the Christian West (2007)

-  Wagner - The Division of the Middle East; the Treaty of Sevres (2004)

-  Wallach - Desert Queen; the Extraordinary Life of Gertrude Bell; Adventure, Advisor of Kings, Ally of Lawrence of Arabia (2005)

-  White - The Emergence of Minorities in the Middle East; the Politics of Community in French Mandate Syria (2011)
